meanings.definition: The basic unit of a chemical element.
meanings.sent1: Atoms combine to form different elements.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of atoms in a laboratory setting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous atoms in the experiment seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, atoms are like the building blocks of nature.
meanings.sent5: Learning about atoms can unlock the secrets of the universe.

meanings.definition: A tiny particle that makes up all matter.
meanings.sent1: The microscope revealed the intricate structure of atoms.
meanings.sent2: Every substance is composed of atoms, even the air we breathe.
meanings.sent3: The atoms in the potion glowed mysteriously in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Atoms are like the invisible threads weaving the fabric of reality.
meanings.sent5: Understanding atoms is key to understanding the world around us.

meanings.definition: A small amount or piece of something.
meanings.sent1: She only had a few atoms of courage left to face her fears.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a pinch of salt, just a few atoms to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent3: His patience was wearing thin, down to the last atoms of tolerance.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, a single atom of water can mean survival.
meanings.sent5: Even the smallest atoms of kindness can make a big difference.
